name: Michelangelo's Creation of Adam by Zaam
description: The Creation of Adam is a fresco painting by Italian artist Michelangelo, which forms part of the Sistine Chapel's ceiling, painted c. 1508â€“1512. It illustrates the Biblical creation narrative from the Book of Genesis in which God gives life to Adam, the first man.   This manipulated piece asks the age old question of chance vs design. Even if we were created by a God, was it predetermined or did god only think of creating us by chance.   Signed and dated by Zaam
